wikipedia_page.main: Sir Benjamin Chilley Campbell Pine (1809–1891) was at various times administrator of Natal, the Gold Coast, Antigua, the Leeward Islands and Western Australia.

response: * July 22 – Sir Benjamin Pine becomes Lieutenant-governor of the Colony of Natal.
| Sir Benjamin PineAlthough formally appointed Governor, Pine never actually came to Western Australia to take up his post; the role was filled by an administrator, Lieutenant Colonel John Bruce.
*# Sir Benjamin Pine, Governor of Western Australia (1868–1869)
*# Sir Benjamin Pine, Governor of Western Australia (1868–1869)

Pinetown was named after the governor of Natal, Sir Benjamin Pine. The town was established in 1850 around the Wayside Hotel, itself built in 1849 along the main wagon route between Durban and Pietermaritzburg. In the Victorian era Pinetown was known as health resort.
* 22 – Sir Benjamin Pine becomes Lieutenant-governor of the Colony of Natal.
* Lieutenant-governor of the Colony of Natal: Sir Benjamin Pine.

The Old Government House in Pietermaritzburg, South Africa, was the official residence of the Lieutenant-Governor of Natal, Sir Benjamin Pine, who arrived in Natal in 1851. The building was completed in the late 1860s. The Natal Government later bought it from Pine and established it as the Government House.

*Governor of Western Australia – Dr John Hampton, then Sir Benjamin PineAlthough formally appointed Governor, Pine never actually came to Western Australia to take up his post; the role was filled by an administrator, Lieutenant Colonel John Bruce.
*Governor of Western Australia – Sir Benjamin Pine (appointed, but not sworn in), Sir Frederick Weld (from 18 September)

*Governor of Western Australia – Sir Benjamin Pine,Although formally appointed Governor, Pine never actually came to Western Australia to take up his post; the role was filled by an administrator, Lieutenant Colonel John Bruce. then The Hon. Sir Frederick Weld GCMG.
